name: Experimentation in Past and Present Techniques
description: This course is a practical investigation of techniques in art that have both historical precedents and contemporary applications. Media covered may include some of the following: mosaic, bas-relief in wood, encaustic, metalpoint drawing, and fresco. Students collaborate to create a mural for a public site.[144P]
prerequisites: Any FAS200 level course and 1.5 credits in FAH/VCC and P.I.
